items.degree: Associate's degree in Computer Information Systems

items.title: Résumé.json
description: Built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Chakra UI, featuring a Monaco Editor for real-time JSON editing and resume customization, allowing users to craft their resumes easily
Enabled dynamic resume templates with live PDF preview for instant download, ensuring users can quickly generate professional resumes in a clean and modern layout
Utilized JSON format for flexibility, supporting multi-resume management and translation, with the ability to store and modify several resumes in one place for different job applications
Integrated an API that allows users to send their JSON and receive a response with a downloadable PDF, enabling users to easily add resume download links to their applications

items.title: Sorting Algorithms Visualizer
description: Developed a visualizer using TypeScript and Next.js to demonstrate popular sorting algorithms like Merge Sort, Quick Sort, and Bubble Sort
Implemented real-time visualization with customizable inputs and adjustable speeds for better algorithm comprehension, allowing users to interactively explore sorting behaviors
Showcased the performance differences between algorithms in terms of time complexity, space efficiency, and best/worst case scenarios, helping users understand algorithmic trade-offs

items.title: Expression Parser
description: Developed a Python-based mathematical expression parser using recursive descent parsing, ensuring correct operator precedence and supporting complex expressions, including parentheses and exponentiation
Implemented error handling for division by zero, invalid syntax, and edge cases to ensure robustness and reliability in various input scenarios, providing meaningful error messages to users
Improved my understanding of compiler design, including abstract syntax trees and parsing techniques, while enhancing skills in handling arithmetic computations efficiently

items.title: Portfolio
description: Built a personal portfolio using React.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS to showcase projects and skills
Designed the site to be easy to navigate across different screen sizes
Served as a practice project to improve front-end development skills with modern technologies
